website_summaries.verdict: The Razer Ifrit is a unique in-ear headset that includes a USB sound card that lets two gamers plug in for recording, but its audio performance doesn't quite measure up to the competition.
pros: USB sound card supports two headsets at once
cons: Doesn't offer much bass power or treble finesse
Microphone isn't quite as clean as similar headsets
No Razer Synapse support for adjusting levels

customer_reviews.title: Sound is okay, but does not work with glasses
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking that i can finally have a lightweight headset that does not push down on my head, but it does not fit well at all with glasses, i had to wear contacts just for these. The sound is so-so, but the volume is very high. One upside is that the mic is very good
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: hmm..
customer_reviews.text: I bought a new product and I got an open box. very disappointed. ------- update -------- I bought a new product and I got an open box. Very disappointed. ------- update -------- I checked the condition and I guess there is no problem, so I decided to use it. I was so disappointed when I received, but when I check the sound with PUBG, I decided to use this. Foot steps during the game was very clear. I don't have to use the headphone. First : 1 star now : 4 star (open box - one star)
customer_reviews.author: NamJoon J.

customer_reviews.title: HEADSETTO HAIR!
customer_reviews.text: No more annoying headset hair on the top of my head! Main reason why i got it. Kinda annoying at first to take it off and on but got used to it now. The case is really really plain and cheap looking but that's just me since i like to collect cases. USB audio enhancer pretty nice. Just make sure to keep the volume on low. Mic sound good on discord. It does it's job perfectly fine.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good.
customer_reviews.text: Really good sound quality, good volume control really nice hardware interface. I bought it because I was out of town and forgot to pack my headset, got them renewed for fairly cheap. I was surprised at the quality for the price, and have started using these as my main headset.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Icarus

customer_reviews.title: Broke in less than 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste $100 on this headset. Buy a cheap pair for $20. My last $20 set lasted 3 years. This set lasted less than 2 months. The mic cut out -- so my essential work headset is now a really expensive pair of ear buds with a foamy ball in front of my face.
customer_reviews.author: Brig

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Work!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best headset w/ mic for work. My work laptop doesn't allow the use of Bluetooth or downloading any software. This headset worked amazingly from the second I plugged it in. I wasn't required to download separate software or anything. Sound is excellent and coworkers say the mic is very clear. I'm connecting to my laptop using the USB connection from the audio enhancer.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Brand

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy.
customer_reviews.text: Way too expensive for a low quality, poorly manufactured item. Great design concept, but the wire is thin and cheap and the ear rest is uncomfortable without any cushion. It has super thin rubber coating on thin wire. The rubber exterior turned brittle and broke after two months of light use. It came coiled up tightly in an overly complicated packaging system. It was difficult to straighten and through its self coiling after each use the rubber broke and the copper interior crimped itself. After a little while the mic stopped working. I tried to let it uncoil and straighten out but the wire broke. They refused to replace the product.
customer_reviews.author: Clint

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, comfort and mic is great!
customer_reviews.text: I prefer these over my more expensive over the head headphones now. Very light, non fatiguing and are perfect for online shooters. I can hear directional cues very good and pick up all the details. Plenty of volume and they isolate outside sound really good when you seat them right in your ears....and no more headphone hair!! Took a chance on these and glad I did...Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great if you don’t have glasses.
customer_reviews.text: Giving this a three star based on how it sits. The audio is good and the voice is good. Just the way it sits if you have glasses can hurt. The audio sometimes sounded like you were in a tunnel.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, lightweight
customer_reviews.text: This headset is awesome. The band behind your head is comfortable, the earbuds are comfortable and the sound is great. The mic is out of the way and easily adjustable. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother buy a blue Yeti.
customer_reviews.text: I was greatly disappointed. It is cheaply made and the sound is nowhere close to my old Yeti mic. So Lesson learned, avoid buying items from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro

customer_reviews.title: A niche product for a niche market
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is what forced us to return this headset. If it didn't use earbuds as their design choice, maybe this would actually suit gamers who have trouble retaining their hair style while murking kids on Fortnite. It's uncomfortable, over priced, and just can't compare to any mid range gaming headset.
customer_reviews.author: Delta Fox

customer_reviews.title: great sound but sized for a man's head
customer_reviews.text: I use this for zoom calls and I am no a gamer. I Iove the sound quality and the adjustable volume control- but the head bracket and over the ears piece, plus the short wires that connect ear buds all are quite large, seems to be for a man's head..I canmake it work, mainly because the sound quality both mic and hearing are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Keel

customer_reviews.title: Light weight for hours of fun!
customer_reviews.text: Great mic for gaming. Only complaint is it does not have a mute button when directly connected to a controller.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Not for large heads
customer_reviews.text: Heaset functions such as boom mic and headphones work awesome. Unit however is not sized for those with big heads. Uncomfortable, plastic stretching and aching around the ears.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous3

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought because I wanted a behind-the-head headset. This one looked reputable, I love razer products. This thing literally shocks you through the earbuds. Poor mic quality
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas A McMillion

customer_reviews.title: Unexpected Zap
customer_reviews.text: I've now had two of these, and both are going back. Constant crackling in the ear buds, along with occasional shocks. Let me tell you, a electrical shock to the inner ear, no matter how mild, hurts.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: Just a bad design overall. The ear buds are not comfortable for more than 30 minutes at a time. I wanted to use this for my laptop and the cord was extremely long.
customer_reviews.author: r3m0

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: The way the headset is design causes discomfort on the inner ridge of your ears and rubs them raw.
customer_reviews.author: Cullen Brimble

customer_reviews.title: Annoying
customer_reviews.text: Wires constantly get tangled and left ear piece stopped working. Mic is poor quality too. Do not buy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bigger Heads Beware
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic headset for the price it is comfortable I wear this for work and have to have it on for a long period of time. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because I wear an 8 in a fitted hat and it doesn’t quite fit my head correctly I wished it had of been adjustable. Also the mic is reallllly sensitive I had to use Voice Meter Banana on computer to mix my chat sounds
customer_reviews.author: John C.

customer_reviews.title: It electrocuted me
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this headset. It's low profile and unobtrusive. It earbuds fit comfortably and were more aesthetically pleasing for me since I use my headsets for both zoom work meetings and gaming. However, the earbuds "shocked" the inside of my ears on more than one occasion (I'm apparently a slow learner). Maybe I just got a defective set, but I sent them back and I'm a little nervous about trying another pair. I guess I'll just continue my search for a less "gamey" style of headphones
customer_reviews.author: Stephie

customer_reviews.title: Tiny Ears, Be Warned!
customer_reviews.text: Granted I have tiny ears to begin with, but these ear pieces are so large and heavy that they would just fall out of my ears. They couldn’t even wedge into my ear opening. Alas, my search for the perfect headset continues.
customer_reviews.author: Smut Face

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: These are great! We use them in our house for our VR headset so we can play games like Rec Room and use the mic. Sound quality (both input and output) is impressive. Fits super comfortable even with the VR headset on. Pros: - Suprisingly nice fit. Comfortable - Plugs into VR HMDs great (Valve Index, Acer WinMR, Oculus Quest (no mic)) - Plugs into normal stereo ports great for just headphones - Works great without the USB attachment - Mic sounds great, not too much extra noise - Headphones have good bass / highs (not an expert) Cons: - Looks a little clunky - Wired Highly Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Abby

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, well balanced headset.
customer_reviews.text: This is very comfortable, can be worn for hours - useful when working on videos. The sound quality is very good, both the playback and the microphone. I am truly impressed. The controls are easy, connecting it is easy, it plugs directly into my laptop. On my desktop I use the included USB adaptor. Well built, it is supplied with a couple of different sized ear thingies. No, I do not know what they are called :) The bit you stick in your ear - it comes fitted with medium, and supplied with small and large! It is all well made, quality construction A very good recording headset.
customer_reviews.author: Smartly Created

customer_reviews.title: Great Microphone and Unique Headset Design
customer_reviews.text: A perfect headset with an exceptionally clear mic, Razer Ifrit: Low Profile Design - Professional Grade Condenser Mic with USB Audio Enhancer is designed to avoid messing your hair up like most other over the head headsets. It's comfortable to wear and light enough to wear for a long time. The cable is plenty long and it also comes with a USB audio enhancer. I recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Mat633

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Overall I like these. I got them because I was looking for something to record my novels with for possible audio books and youtube videos. I like the sound on playback. My only issue is that after a certain period of time, maybe a couple hours, they hurt my ears and I have to take them out and give my ears a break. Other than that, they're really nice and work just like they're supposed to. They'd be good for podcasts or video, online interviews or, like I'm doing, audio books.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy C.

customer_reviews.title: You can't go wrong with Razer !
customer_reviews.text: We have a Razer keyboard, a Razer mouse, so it's only acceptable to get the Razer headphones. Like all the other products they make this is quality! My husband plays mainly WoW on the PC and uses headphones occasionally. These are great if you are tired of having big bulky headphones on your head! They are slim and low profile. Easy to connect to a PC.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: works pretty well
customer_reviews.text: I like the setup with the microphome--ear buds instead of cans if you prefer that for longer streaming sessions--microphone is crisp, nice to include usb plug to split audio signal. Not sure if the audio enhancer made a huge difference, but it is nice to have!
customer_reviews.author: @youcantseeme

customer_reviews.title: Hurts Ears After a While...
customer_reviews.text: Wore them for about 2 1/2 hours and my ears started hurting during a gaming session. They arent the most comfortable but its nice that they are light.
customer_reviews.author: dylanbecks

customer_reviews.title: When it comes to serious talking on the phone...
customer_reviews.text: Nothing comes close to the quality and comfort of this headset. It rests comfortably on the ears and the microphone is close to the mouth, but not obstructive.
customer_reviews.author: Erol Esen

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality but hard to situate on my head because I wear glasses to see and it won’t fit right with them on, sadly. I wanted this to work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie V. Galasso

product_meta.title: Razer Ifrit: Low Profile Design - Professional Grade Condenser Mic with USB Audio Enhancer - Duo-Streaming Capability - Gaming, Streaming, and Broadcaster Headset
product_meta.description: The Razer Ifrit is especially suitable for mobile broadcasters with a low profile, easily transportable design and simple, single-wire connection. The microphone brings clarity and fidelity to mobile streaming that is far superior to standard mobile handset microphones. The Razer Ifrit is also compatible with both Xbox One and PS4 through the connection on the joypad or via the Razer Audio Enhancer on the PS4.
feature_bullets: Pro-Grade Adjustable Condenser Mic - The Razer Ifrit has its own adjustable condenser mic that reduces the pickup of background noise without the need to position it on a mic arm
Feature-Packed Discreet Design - Ifrit's slim frame and over-the-ear design makes it super discreet, keeping all focus on you during a broadcast
Ergonomic and Comfortable - With improved ergonomics that provide a natural fit for different face shapes, the headset fits so comfortably you won't even remember it's on
Two 3.5mm Combo Jacks - aver USB Audio Enhancer allows up to two 3.5 mm analog devices to be plugged in
Flat Frequency Response - With flat frequency response, you'll always know exactly how you sound like to your viewers
